item.title: About
item.description:
About Andromeda Law

Modern Legal Services for Today’s Clients

Andromeda Law was founded with a simple premise: legal services should adapt to how people actually live and work today. As an online-only law firm serving clients across Ontario, we’ve eliminated the inefficiencies of traditional law practice while maintaining the highest standards of professional service.

Our Approach

We believe that:

  • Your Time Matters: Legal services shouldn’t require taking time off work for in-person meetings when a video call would serve the same purpose.
  • Transparency is Essential: From our pricing to our processes, we believe in being clear and direct about what to expect.
  • Technology Should Serve You: We leverage modern tools not because they’re new, but because they make your experience better and more efficient.
  • Quality Doesn’t Require Overhead: By operating virtually, we eliminate unnecessary costs while maintaining professional excellence.

What Sets Us Apart

Online-Only Practice

Unlike traditional firms that added virtual services during COVID-19, we were designed from the ground up to operate online. This isn’t an adaptation—it’s our foundation.

item.title: Collections
item.description:
Collections

Recovering unpaid debts requires a strategic approach that balances cost-effectiveness with results. At Andromeda Law, we’ve developed streamlined processes to help businesses and individuals recover what they’re owed efficiently.

Our Approach to Collections

We handle collections matters through a systematic process designed to maximize recovery while minimizing costs:

1. Initial Assessment

  • Review of debt documentation
  • Validation of limitation periods
  • Debtor locating services when needed
  • Strategic planning based on debt amount and circumstances

2. Pre-Litigation Collections

  • Professional demand letters
  • Structured negotiation attempts
  • Payment plan arrangements
  • Documentation of all collection attempts

3. Legal Proceedings

Small Claims Court (Debts up to $35,000)

  • Streamlined filing process
  • Default judgment applications where appropriate
  • Settlement conference representation
  • Trial representation if necessary

Superior Court (Debts over $35,000)

  • Statement of Claim preparation
  • Motion for summary judgment when applicable
  • Full litigation services
  • Settlement negotiation

4. Judgment Enforcement

  • Examination in aid of execution
  • Wage garnishment
  • Bank account garnishment
  • Writ of seizure and sale

item.title: Estates Litigation
item.description:
Estates Litigation

Dealing with disputes over wills and estates can be emotionally taxing and legally complex. At Andromeda Law, we provide compassionate and strategic representation to help you navigate these sensitive matters, ensuring your rights and interests are protected throughout the process.

Understanding Estates Litigation

Estates litigation involves legal disputes related to the administration of a deceased person’s estate. These disputes can arise for various reasons, including disagreements over the validity of a will, the interpretation of its terms, or the actions of executors and trustees. Our goal is to help you resolve these issues efficiently and amicably whenever possible, but we are fully prepared to advocate for your interests in court if necessary.

General Employment Law Advice

Employment relationships can present various legal challenges. Andromeda Law offers general legal advice to both employees and employers on a wide range of employment law matters.

  • Workplace Harassment and Discrimination: Guidance on addressing and resolving issues related to harassment or discrimination.
  • Leaves of Absence: Understanding your rights regarding medical leave, parental leave, and other statutory leaves.

For Employers

  • Workplace Policies: Assisting in developing compliant policies on harassment, discrimination, and workplace safety.
  • Termination Procedures: Advising on lawful termination practices to minimize legal risks.
  • Employment Standards Compliance: Ensuring your business adheres to the Employment Standards Act and other relevant legislation.

item.title: Small Claims Flat Fee Structure
item.description:
Small Claims Court Fee Structure

Small Claims Court is designed to handle monetary disputes between $10,000 and $35,000 in a more streamlined way than Superior Court. At Andromeda Law, we’ve developed a predictable flat-fee structure that breaks the process into clear stages, helping you understand both the costs and process upfront.

Cost Overview

Using a $25,000 claim as an example:

  • Initial Consultation: $300
  • Claim Filing Stage: $1,875 (7.5% of claim amount)
  • Settlement Conference Stage: $1,875 (7.5% of claim amount)
  • Disbursements: Typically $200-400 (court fees, process service, etc.) Total: Approximately $4,250-4,450

item.title: Superior Court Litigation
item.description:
Superior Court Litigation

The Superior Court of Justice handles a wide range of civil litigation matters that require experienced legal representation. Andromeda Law is prepared to assist clients with various types of Superior Court cases, offering personalized attention and strategic advocacy.

Our Services

We provide legal representation in diverse Superior Court matters, including but not limited to:

  • Contract Disputes: Handling breaches of contract and enforcement of agreements.
  • Tort Claims: Representing clients in cases involving negligence, defamation, and other civil wrongs.
  • Employment Litigation: Assisting with employment-related disputes, such as wrongful dismissal claims and employment contract issues.
  • Estates Litigation: Managing disputes over wills and estates at the Superior Court level. Learn more on our Estates Litigation page.

Our Approach

  • Personalized Consultation: We understand that every case is unique. We offer an initial consultation to discuss your specific legal matter and determine how we can assist you.
  • Strategic Advocacy: Crafting tailored legal strategies aimed at achieving the best possible outcome for your case.
  • Transparent Communication: Keeping you informed at every stage of the litigation process.

Ready to Discuss Your Case?

If you’re involved in a civil dispute requiring Superior Court litigation, we’re here to help. Whether your matter falls within our highlighted practice areas or involves a different type of dispute, we invite you to reach out for a consultation.
